website_summaries.verdict: This hard drive’s huge amount of storage, cool fanless design, and ability to move data at impressive speeds make it a must-have if you’re dealing with a massive amount of data.
cons: Mac users will need to reformat the hard drive to use it

customer_reviews.title: I've had two defective units
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and received it two days ago. I plugged it in and started copying files from my old external hard drive. I heard a loud, grinding sound which didn't sound normal to me. I called Toshiba tech support and let them listen to it over the phone. He said that's not normal and I should return it. Amazon sent the replacement which I received today. It's making the same sound. I called Toshiba again and let another guy hear it. He said the same thing. I'm not sure I want to try a third one. ON the Toshiba website they specifically mention that this drive is "whisper quiet". I'm very disappointed and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: Great for back up and for main operational media.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent as always. I have four other Canvio's that have been running for me for several years of various different capacities and the only failure I have ever had was when I knocked one over while it was running. My own fault. I mainly use them for back ups but with a couple I use them as my main HD's mainly for video, but then I have another as a back up for these. My MacBook Pro just does not have enough HD space let alone for back ups. This is very inexpensive back up media that so far I can highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use external hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box, backed up 2+ terabytes of my miscellaneous data, and accesses information without delay. This hard drive is "head and shoulders" above any of the Western Digital junk drives. I wanted an externally powered (non-usb) external hard drive and this one was just right. Well done Toshiba!
customer_reviews.author: cookin' dude

customer_reviews.title: I have been dealing with problems with this computer for months
customer_reviews.text: and now they do not seem to want to deal with me.... first the computer would only show the DELL trademark and then turn off..... Then the USB ports would not recognize a 5T Toshiba external hard drive I was able to resolve these problems.... Now whenever I plug anything into the USB ports I get a power surge message and no amount of resetting or restarting this computer helps.... This is a dud .... I am a handicapped 69 year old person living on a small social security check and Medicare Medicaid and I cannot afford this lose.....
customer_reviews.author: tomcatrebel

customer_reviews.title: adequately happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Only issue is that it requires the computer to have an 8gb program installed to be able to make any changes to the hard drive. Not an issue if you have the space and it remains at home, but forget taking this to use to transfer items on to or from other computers that are not your own.
customer_reviews.author: Lemley

customer_reviews.title: Good Xbox One expansion drive
customer_reviews.text: Quiet enough for the living room attached to the Xbox One. It has an external power supply that acted like it would be powered on at all times before it was connected, but it turns on and off automatically with the Xbox no problem.
customer_reviews.author: slack

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba hard drive Would not power up
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I never took it out of the box for a couple of months and when I did it didn’t work at all. Tried it on 3 laptops to make sure that the usb connections were working and all was good. The hard drive would not power up or able to be recognized
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Well where to start? First the AC adapter broke the first day. You could tell it was made from a very low quality wire just by touching it. Then the USB 3.0 kept disconnecting. The wire seems tough but it kept poping out. And once I finally got it to work by replacing the AC adapter and holding the USB in place it wouldn't register the device in the device folder. The computer did register the USB cable but did not show it in the appropriate folder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old, loud, and slow
customer_reviews.text: Super loud spin up and operating noise, terribly slow write speed, super slow to mount on certain systems. This is clearly an old crappy line of drives they discontinued and I’m not content with amazon dumping on me for a supposed “sale”. I’ll go to Costco and get a modern drive for the same price with more capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Best bang-for-the-buck external 7200 RPM 3TB drive
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't used Toshiba drives in the past, other than one old laptop drive (which was durable but noisy), but after eliminating Seagate, Western Digital, etc. while searching for an inexpensive, non-failure-prone 7200 RPM external 3TB HD, ended up with this product, which has been great. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lee H.

customer_reviews.title: The drive works but the power cord sucks
customer_reviews.text: This unit would get a better rating but the power cord did not work. Once I used a power cord that outputs 12 volts it works. It is quieter than a WD My Book that I have that speed working. I like the fact that it is visible when I first plugged it in. I like that I can use my own method/ software to back up my data.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I use this hard drive for all my photos and videos. I have it hooked up to an iMAC computer that is 3 years old. Its a fine hard drive, but it takes a long time to save or retrieve anything on or off of it. I don't know if thats my computer or the drive itself. Overall I'm happy with it. It does what I want - the price was ok - the process is just slow. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DogStarDon

customer_reviews.title: Goes to sleep randomly
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is probably on of the worst harddrives I've ever used, it transfers data fine and does most things you'd expect form harddrive. The issue is Toshiba put there ridiculous energy saver software which makes it shut down randomly and causes all sorts of errors, which makes the drive useless.
customer_reviews.author: A proud mom

customer_reviews.title: Large fast
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right in as USB device. Less than a year old and there is an intermittent problem where the power supply plugs in. (Wiggle it just right, and it reappears.) Working my way through Toshiba warranty process now.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton E. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon had the best price when I ordered the item but the price went up by $40+ after a few days. Coupled with Toshiba quality and reputation, I consider this a wise investment. Installation and set up on an iMac went so smoothly with excellent step-by-step Apple Support. The unit has been in operation for less than a week with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: YTA

customer_reviews.title: Noisiest HDD I'v ever owned
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says, this is the noisiest HDD I'v ever owned. I have no idea how good a device it is. I have to turn it off--rather just pull the plug because it won't disconnect when I click on that particular icon--when I'm around it because it makes a racket. It sounds like the ghost of Jacob Marley clanging down the stairs. So meh.
customer_reviews.author: Skwint

customer_reviews.title: No complaints so far. Plug & play into my ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far. Plug & play into my Windows 7 laptop. Dropped files in to copy & done.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great storage bad cable connection
customer_reviews.text: This external drive is great and I have very few problems with the drive itself. My only problem is the USB connector cable between the external drive and the computer you are using it with. quite simply the cable consistently falls out of the external drive constantly. It might just be the position i keep the external drive at in relation to my laptop but it is annoying when part way through a transfer the external drive disconnects. other than that this external drive is worth the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Really noisy.
customer_reviews.text: This drive satisfies all my computer storage needs, but sounds like your stomach growling when it's working. If you can put it somewhere out of your hearing it's ideal. Great performance, bad digestion.
customer_reviews.author: Woof

customer_reviews.title: HIgher read/write speed makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: I never realized what a difference in the lag time there was between 5600 and 7200 RPMs. I've been enjoying this external drive for a couple of months now, and it performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kam G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice 7200RPM drive
customer_reviews.text: Great spinning platter HD. A lot of drives are USB 3, but 5400RPM, which is why they don't give disk speed in the specifications (Western Digital!). This drive is fast and large enough for your media files, and won"t stutter while streaming media.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pontious

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It broke on me. Had it for less than a month and it quit working for me. Its also big and bulky and requires an outlet to use instead of just hooking it up to a USB port
customer_reviews.author: Tyler k.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a good hard drive , works excellent, the size is bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Reikoman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive to use as a backup for my desktop. It was super easy to set up and has been working without fault since I first plugged it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only time will tell and drive had an old version of their back up program
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a good package and only time will tell if I am really happy with the product. Set up of the back up program did not go well. The very first thing I had to do was update the software to a newer version. It took several days to do the 'plug and play' part to where I was confident that I had a backup/image of my drive and files.
customer_reviews.author: Inkman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for two months now. the only problem I have is that it slows down the computer a lot. no other trouble yet.
customer_reviews.author: NAMac

customer_reviews.title: check adapter
customer_reviews.text: however, I am speaking of toshiba in general, This one arrived with a power adapter not compatible with usa plugs, curently attempting to resolve
customer_reviews.author: Rodger C. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: I love this little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget. It is powerful enough to backup all my technical needs, and makes me feels secure that I hold it all on one device that can handle the job on task and doesn't need to use several disc, or some company's cloud service which they have control over.
customer_reviews.author: Luv v

customer_reviews.title: horrible  never worked amazon refuses to replace. do not ever by from amazon!!
customer_reviews.text: horrible never worked, when it would load it was not readable or writable and even though it is sold by amazon.com they will not replace it or give me a refund. horrible.horrible horrible product and even worse customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Merrideth Chase

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Windows Automatic Backup.
customer_reviews.text: This item functions properly, but it's not compatible with, or suitable for Windows backup. After researching the topic a bit, I found that the sector size was too large, and is done that way by manufacturers for a number of reasons, primarily to squeeze more data on the platter. If you just want to offload big files for 'off PC' storage, this item is fine, but for automatic Windows backup, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a quality product that does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: Slow dual drive
customer_reviews.text: This 6TB takes a long time to spin up to speed. Time to move on to SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Space-Time
customer_reviews.text: Had the space needed, but very slow with the backup software and USB on he initial backup. Will need to readjust settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: We've had it up and running for a while now with no problems. No overheating. Easy to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to format.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second drive I have for back-up. I bought the second one so I could mirror my back-ups with no worries if I lose one or the other drive. Files are getting to be too large and I will most likely need to buy a third drive and compress some of the data stored. The third drive will be the same as this, because of reliability!
customer_reviews.author: Randall W Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Great drive for storage and gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Great hard drive to store games on and play from. I verified that the hard drive speed is 7200rpm and it is fast enough to play most games off of.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hatlewick

customer_reviews.title: Plugged in for a large backup and after an hour ...
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in for a large backup and after an hour started loud clicking, popping and whinng sounds. Not acceptable, reliability is totally questionable.
customer_reviews.author: spirit

customer_reviews.title: Cheap 4Gb. Of space for any home purpose use.
customer_reviews.text: I installed it without doing any adjustments. Out of 4Gb you get out of the box 3.7Gb, not too bad. Has sofware included but very simple, basically for backups.
customer_reviews.author: Metalguard

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive to store photos and important documents. I had about 3T worth of data stored and then in Sept, after about 4 months of use. The drive had a catastrophic failure and I lost most of my important data. After spending more than $300 to get the data recovered, unsuccessfully, I am not a happy camper and would not purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. P.

customer_reviews.title: It Does What I Bought It For
customer_reviews.text: I bought the USB drive to record movies. I plugged it in and it works. What more can I say.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop drive
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on my Mac. Had to reformat which took only a few minutes. After that was ready to go. FYI. For Mac you can read the drive when you plug it in but you can't actually write to it until you reformat it. Has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Mont

customer_reviews.title: It works fine. Just plug it in.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. Just plug it in. A blue LED lights up when it in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item was perfect! It stores small to large, anything! Works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sena B

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Good price. I needed a larger and faster backup solution and this drive has certainly met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Belanger

customer_reviews.title: You can't never go wrong with TOSHIBA
customer_reviews.text: The disk came in perfect conditions, just took it out of the box and plugged it...Voila!. Super quite, super fast (i copied 134 gbs in less than 5 minutes). Also when reading from it i see no lag. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ilvin Toy Trinidad

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: So far so good no problems or issues. I have this connected to Windows 10 and all of a sudden the 777GB of files appeared to be gone on this drive. I think it was a windows 10 issue...manager showed that there were 777 GB used on the drive...I wound up restoring to a different time and the files came back whew..
customer_reviews.author: techie girl

customer_reviews.title: Plug issue resolved. Working fine now.
customer_reviews.text: Mine also came with a plug from Mars, or Pluto, or Jupiter - it does not fit North American outlet, and it does not resemble the plug for any place I've traveled. Think I'll just return it. I checked the packaging one last time and......... found the plug dongle which slides in to the adapter. There was NOTHING in the instructions regarding this, and the tiny part was attached to a big hunk of bubble wrap - you would never know it's there without searching. This is the only plug like this I've ever seen on any device.
customer_reviews.author: an Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Set up for Linux
customer_reviews.text: Tech recommended and was set up for Linux. Nice drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working fine. But these products need significant time to be tested.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Works As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected; not had the same issues I've had with some other external drives.
customer_reviews.author: JAY C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it and recommend it totally, I used this to backup all of my anime, games, pc games etc.....
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This did not come with the adapter or plug, or USB cable
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Receive hard drive and it appeared to be opened and used. The hard drive was a larger size than expected but could have lived with that. The interior package was opened and the contents were warped in bags that had been torn and appeared to be used. I tried the plug into my laptop and the computer did not recognize the drive. Didn’t think it was appropriate to ship what appears to be a used device when it was sold as a new.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Non U.S. power plug
customer_reviews.text: This came with a power plug that was not a U.S. compatible plug. I contacted Toshiba to see if they could send me a U.S. plug. The representative repeatedly told me that I need to follow the directions provided with the product, even though I explained to him I did not have the proper power plug. I contacted Amazon and they immediately provided with a return label.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Leis

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd expansion
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd expansion. Well made, no failure (knock-on-wood). I write my review before, so no need to repeat.
customer_reviews.author: RyanG5

customer_reviews.title: Great drive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as an SSD, but I'm using it for backup so not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Toshiba Desktop external is a good deal if you need 5TB of extra storage or backup space.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased dozens of Toshiba portable USB 3.0 hard drives and have had no issues, so when I needed 2 x 5TB drives I decided to try the Toshiba desktop external drive. So far they are both working as expected. If you do buy one be careful because the 2 prong AC adapter for the power brick almost got thrown away. At first I thought it was missing but later found it in the bubble pack in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Product was not new and missing pieces.  Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I saw some bad reviews but figured they were special cases. Apparently not. This did not come with any way to plug in to the standard United States outlet. The box it came in was opened, seal broken... aka... NOT NEW. It was dusty. Just a complete waste of my time where I could tell in 10 seconds this had to be returned. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: two strikes... you'r out!
customer_reviews.text: This second one in a week is not being recognized by my PC. Toshiba support says the drive probably has a bad sector(?) but two of them within a week? The quick instructions don't even say to connect the power supply... just plug in the USB cable. It does look nice though.
customer_reviews.author: gildy

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR THE MAC USER
customer_reviews.text: This drive is pure garbage for a mac user. It might be fine for a windows user but if you have a mac DO NOT BUY THIS DRIVE!!! The file system is cumbersome for mac and when I tried to reformat it with the mac disk utility it became unreadable and unmountable. It is now an expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: D.R. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize it has to have a 120-volt power connection in addition to the USB connection. Shame on me for not researching it enough. Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shirey

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: Installed, kept getting errors, wouldn't hold the format for my Mac (Mac OS Extended Journaled), kept reverting to Windows. Sending it back, I've never had this much trouble with an external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sound Investor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What a deal... 3TB for the price can not be beat.
customer_reviews.author: peter beltran

customer_reviews.title: after 3 hours can easily go up to 70 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Too hot, after 3 hours can easily go up to 70 degrees. Plan to de-shell when drive is stable.
customer_reviews.author: allanlee

customer_reviews.title: The power cord came defective and I did not receive ...
customer_reviews.text: The power cord came defective and I did not receive a new one. I even took pictures and sent them to Toshiba to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Jalet

customer_reviews.title: Product Not Password Protected
customer_reviews.text: This drive was advertised as being password protected. Both the description and the photo of the box provided by Amazon showed the product as being password protected. When I received the product and followed the software installation instructions (the manual had to be found online), it did not prompt me to enter a password as the instructions indicated. Upon looking further, the box that I received had red tape marked over the lock symbol, and this drive was not password protected. I don't know who was deceptive - Amazon or Toshiba, but I immediately returned the product. Fortunately I had not transferred any files to the drive. Check your packaging before installing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lead it ok as long as it price is good LEAD
customer_reviews.text: Oh it the greatest thing next to milk i love it perfect and the cost unreal it like they gave to me with lead who cares if lead bad for you what matters is the cost who cares if my kids come out retarded that ok with me at least i got 5 tb hard drive thank a lot you guys got my back
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Pena

product_meta.title: Toshiba 6TB Canvio for Desktop 7200 RPM External Hard Drive, USB 3.0 (HDWC360XK3JA),black
product_meta.description: Capacity:6TB| Style:No softwareFrom the manufacturer Canvio for Desktop Hard Drive Centralize Your Content Toshiba Canvio for Desktop External Hard Drive lets you store your files in a centralized place next to your computer. It is easy to set up and is excellent for expanding your storage needs. Stylish and Versatile Design The Canvio for Desktop offers high capacity storage in a compact design that saves your precious desk space. It can be placed vertically or horizontally to fit your space, whether in your home or office. Its fan less design makes drive operation whisper quiet while keeping the drive cool. Keep Your Data Safe The Canvio for Desktop comes with a built in security lock slot to help anchor and deter theft. Protect your private data and secure the drive using the security lock slot. What's in the Box Features High Performance Drive The Canvio for Desktop is powered by Toshiba’s 7200 RPM drive with 128MB buffer to help deliver a reliable and responsive performance. The built in USB 3.0 Interface significantly improves file transfer performance for large media files and dramatically minimizes the wait time for backup. Plus, it is backwards compatible with USB 2.0 devices Massive Capacity The Canvio for Desktop gives you the freedom to 'go big' with everything you do—from gig plus videos and graphic design files to numerous photo outtakes and multiple archives of your HD content. It is designed to help you store, organize, and keep safe every aspect of your digital life, with room to grow — offering up to 6TB ( 1 ) capacity. Easy to Use Ready to use out of the box with no software to install. Just plug it in to your computer and to your external power source and start saving all your content and files with terabytes of extra storage space. Disclaimers 1. Actual formatted capacity may vary. For details, please visit our official website. 2. Standard limited warranty terms apply. The warranty brochure is preloaded on the hard drive or can be viewed online. 3. Compatibility may vary depending on user’s hardware configuration and operating system. Drive formatted NTFS for Windows based PC. Reformatting required for Mac computers. 4. Product specifications, colors, features, and availability are subject to change without notice. Capacity:6TB | Style:No software Toshiba Canvio for desktop external hard drive lets you store your files in a centralized place next to your computer. It is easy to set up and is excellent for expanding your storage needs. This drive offers high capacity storage in a compact design that saves your precious desk space. Its fan less design makes drive operation whisper Quiet while keeping the drive cool. The built in USB 3.0 interface significantly improves file transfer performance for large media files and dramatically minimizes the wait time for backup. Plus, it is backwards compatible with USB 2.0 devices. The new Canvio for desktop is ready to use out of the box with no software to install. Just plug it in to your computer and start saving all your content and files with terabytes of extra storage space.
feature_bullets: Compact, versatile design helps reduce desktop clutter
High capacity storage for organizing all your music, videos, photos, and other files in one place
Powered by Toshiba 7200 RPM drive to help deliver a reliable and responsive performance
Built in security lock slot to help keep your drive safe from theft

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars183 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
